Sphero Bolt Driver Module

This module contains the scripts and launch files necessary for controlling the Sphero Bolt in various scenarios.

Launch Files

The module contains the 2 launch files: - launch/multi_sphero_driver.launch: - launch/single_sphero_driver.launch:

As the name suggest, the first launch file is used to launch driver for multiple robots at the same time, by sequentially launching the single_sphero_driver.launch file.

Scripts

The module contains the following scripts: - scripts/sphero_bolt_driver_node.py: This script is the main script that is used to control the robots. The script is responsible for sending the appropriate commands to the robots based on their position and the mission. The script is also responsible for receiving the robots messages and to process them if needed.

API Documentation

sphero_bolt_driver_node.py: a wrapper to operate a Sphero BOLT robot with the Robot Operating System (ROS) and the spherov2 Python library.

ms_to_speed(linear_x)[source]

Check for a shake transition based on accelerometer data.

This method monitors the linear acceleration of the device and checks if it exceeds 75% of the gravitational constant (g) in either the x or y axis. If the acceleration threshold is exceeded, the method logs the event, disables the IR signal, and returns True.

Returns:

True if a shake transition is detected, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool
